Reviews.Title: “Lovely Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: GinaBif
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here for a little getaway. The Resort is a little bit outdated but the views are incredible and the staff is very nice. Our room was clean, we had a little kitchenette and it was just steps to the water. We will definitely return to El Caribe, it was a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled - it's great!!”
Reviews.Author: krimicri
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend at the El Caribe resort and couldn't be happier!! The price was right, the room was extremely clean, as were the premises, and the staff was SUPER friendly and helpful. Every employee has a friendly smile for you and offers their assistance if you need it. Check in was fast and easy, they let us check in early and upgraded us to a room with a kitchen at no extra charge. There are 2 pools, I think one is a salt-water pool, overlooking the ocean. Basketball, volleyball, shuffleboard courts, plenty of places to lounge and enjoy the beach. Continental breakfast from 6:30a - 9:30a consisting of bagels, danishes, yogurt, OJ, milk, cereal.. worked for us! There aren't really any hotspots nearby but within a 2 mile range you can find something easily. The Ocean Deck is right up by the pier (great place!) as well as Joe's Crab Shack on the pier.. my first time there - I loved it! Grocery store/pub across the street from the hotel (Don't go to Stavros! = EW!). I can't think of one bad thing to say about El Caribe.. we were hesitant upon arrival but very pleased when we got there and checked it out, and we will definitely be going back! Thank you guys for a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dm4287
Reviews.Content: I have been to El Caribe many times. I also had my recent family reunion there. The staff was very friendly to us and arranged our rooms adjacent. Each one had a fabulous view of the ocean and every one was pleased. There is a wading pool for the little ones. The landscape is lush with mature trees and is very beautiful. The rooms were spacious and had kitchenettes with a grocery store across the street. I have stayed there many times. I will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “el caribe summer vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie O
Reviews.Content: Staff is extremely friendly & helpful in helping us find activities for the kids, movie theatre and other beaches as well as places to eat. Room was clean and affordable. Close to the Daytona boardwalk. The family had the best time in the pool and beach area. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This is my 15th year and last stay”
Reviews.Author: southern g
Reviews.Content: I have always been a very dedicated to El Caribe. This is not the same motel, this year there was roaches in room and when we called front desk would not do anything. Then a large church group came in and was very disrestful and loud. They kept us up all night for 2 nights in a row. I called down to front desk about the commotion and they refused to do anything about this group. the next morning was sent to speak with this Jamician woman and she was rude and would not make anything good. We were their 3 days and housekeeping kept sticking head in door wanting to know if there was anything that we needed and did not touch room for 3 days. I do not know who owns this motel but it has not bween the same since Marianne sold it !!!!!!! I will not be back

Reviews.Title: “Not so pleased”
Reviews.Author: JEAN005
Reviews.Content: I love the El Caribe stayed here many times, but I'm not pleased with them now. I was told it's a no pet property and I see people with their dogs there. I spoke to a lady in management she told me only certain rooms allow pets upstairs the office and I see people in the towers with Dogs and said the apy a pet fee to have their dog there. That's not fair. If it's no dog its no dog.

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: usatallone
Reviews.Content: I don't know if all the rooms have connecting doors to the other room next to yours, but ours did and it turned out to be kinda of an international exchange program. Because we got to know the folks from Columbia sooooooooo well as we heard literally every thing they said and did through the paper thin door. This old hotel has seen better days. The rooms are clean, two small pools, right on the beach, antique tv's in the rooms, free breakfast in the morning (don't expect much). There's too many hotels on the beach that try a lot harder to earn your business. So, we say "thanks for the experience" and we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Truth...The View is Great, but the Hotel Not So!”
Reviews.Author: ky_traveler2010
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for two nights after reading the othe reviews our Trip Advisor describing the hotel as older, but clean. This could not be farther from the truth!!! The outstide of the building is in much need of repair and makes the building look like it belongs in the slums. The room itself had a musty smell, the door did seal all the way, the lock had been bent, and the front office staff was not the friendliest. I would say the carpet and bedding was from the 1990's. I would never, ever stay here again despite the price and the great ocean view. It is true you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: Marla N
Reviews.Content: When we got to the motel, things seems to be o.k. our room was clean, the staff was nice,but things got bad fast, first was the pool it was closed for repairs the second day we were there, the staff said this was a every other day thing FIX IT BEFORE SUMMER!!!, then our bathroom tub wouldn't drain, our balcony door wouldn't close right, and wi-fi was terrible.On our third day there was a church group came in with about 150 teenagers that were loud and had no respect for others, we tried to get a refund to move to another motel, to no avail,and spoke the manager about the noise to no avail. I came here to relax not listen to kids scream all night, If I would have know about the group we would have chose another motel.The rates were within reason, but the motel needs alot of work. Do your self a favor, and ask alot of questions before you book at a motel(example:do you cater to large groups) because when the pool was finally open the group filled up the pool and my family couldn't even enjoy it. They also had a cont. breakfast but with a large kids group there they didn't leave anything for the other guests in the motel to eat, they have a banquet room the kids could have ate in there.We will not stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs and bull crap'”
Reviews.Author: Jamaica B
Reviews.Content: On our first night stay i killed a live cock roach in the shower! I called the front desk to resolve this problem and no one respond. The mini fridge was rusted, dirty and nasty. The tv holder was chipped and has mole. The curains, plugs, and doors are molded with black spots. I had to go to tne dollar general and purchase bleach cleaner until i could purchase another hotel room. The front desk staff was uncertain and liars' no one tried to resolve my issues. Breakfast was a host nothing as advertised. I would not recommend any of my fami,yand friends tostay here everyagain buti would recommend thwt tbey replace their staff.

Reviews.Title: “bugs, unfrindley staff, and security issues”
Reviews.Author: SkipSmith_12
Reviews.Content: I was told I would have ocean front room and when I checked in we were put into room 101 and it has no view, bugs and the back door was tampered with. The maintanance guy was the only nice person that I talked to. The lady at the front does not like whit people and she has a very bad attitude. The managers do not take care of problems, and I'm never going to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: I had not been to Daytona in years and really did not know where to stay so I went on the Internet and looked at a few places and read the reviews and if you book a hotel by the reviews then you would not stay anywhere. I decided on the El Caribe and was very nervous the closer we got to Daytona not really knowing what to expect. Well let me say we were very pleased. Yes it is an older bldg. but it still looks nice. It is right on the beach has 2 pools and a kiddie pool. From the moment we checked in the entire staff was so friendly and they all seemed to enjoy their job. Our room was fantastic and very very clean. Security is on staff at all times. Lots of pool chairs and umbrellas. The price was great. We are already planning our next trip and we will be staying at El Caribe. We had ocean front efficiency room. Plenty of Hot water. I saw one review where they had Murphy Beds our room did not. Go on El Caribe website and you can see pictures of the rooms and what they have to offer. Our room looked just like it did on the internet. Excellent WiFi connection. Wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Carrie Y
Reviews.Content: great price on hot wire book before you look. I took my grand children for two days they loved the pools we had an ocean ft room, room was clean and beds were comfortable. Most of the staff was great! the middle aged woman who worked the breakfast was kind and very informative, she was able to answer all our questions, She was very professional, keep her hair pulled back and constantly keep everything stocked and clean. Check in at front desk was very fast. we got there early and was able to check into room. My only evaluation I found to be in need of assistance was the maid service, our second day our room was by passed by maid service they just looked unhappy and unwilling to assist. I go to beach often for a few days at a time and I will return here, I found the El Caribe to be a better value then the Hilton

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in Daytona.”
Reviews.Author: Joe K
Reviews.Content: El Caribe was not our primary choice, but we did get a reasonable rate so we booked the room. First, the positives. Our room was very big, had a great view of the ocean, and a full kitchen! A nice pool area, easy access straight to the beach, plenty of parking, and friendly staff helped make the stay nicer. As for the problems, there were many, none of which by themselves I would call a deal breaker. For starters, the "free breakfast" is anything but. You can get some cereal, prepackaged pastries, yogurt, milk, OJ, and a bagel, and that is the entirety of the breakfast menu. Every door slams shut and you will hear doors slamming all day and night. The wifi internet didn't work at all, or was barely functional when it did work. Instead, connect to the wifi at next door Perry's Resort, it at least works. The hot water takes forever to get going and the water pressure is barely enough to take a shower. Every time someone in the building flushes a toilet, your shower will slow to a drip for quite awhile before powering back up again. The ceiling leaked in parts of the room, though it did rain non-stop for the duration of our stay. The beds fold-out from a closet (I'm not kidding), and they were mostly uncomfortable and too small. The elevators only worked half the time. Finally, on the last day of our stay I found a dead cockroach by the couch. The A/C leaked water all over the carpets. I would not stay here again, and I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location”
Reviews.Author: Wendy S
Reviews.Content: My room was nice and clean. I had a wonderful oceanfront balcony. Pools were nice. I was traveling alone and wasn't very comfortable walking on the street alone. Hotel is not in the best location. Next time I would stay closer to ocean walk!

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the price for an oceanfront room”
Reviews.Author: Mark-nole
Reviews.Content: If you're put off by a slightly musty, 'beachy' smell when you walk in your room, you might not agree with this review. But that's about the only negative. My room was very clean (especially the bathroom) and there were no bugs to be seen. Yes, the El Caribe has seen better days, but it's very well-maintained. With a little online research you can get a really good deal here. All rooms are oceanview or oceanfront, and all have great balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for large room w/ kitchen”
Reviews.Author: OcalaBourbon
Reviews.Content: A little nervous after checking some reviews ,booked it anyway thru Yahoo travel,for a "double queen/Ocean front" accomodation. Greeted by a friendly staff at desk. Got a great/large room ,with southeast view of ocean(not ocean front as requested)very clean,Nicely furnished,even had complete kitchen ,dining area.double sink bathroom .double couch,etc.Certainly wasn't the standard room one normally might expect,at this price. Only serious complaint...two double beds in Murphy bed enclosures side by side,are not "Queen beds". Friendly staff, ,clean room , Nice grounds ,two pools. b-b-que grills....7th floor..great view.....We will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Easy on the wallet”
Reviews.Author: Skippymom
Reviews.Content: We booked this stay on Hotwire and so I was nervous about staying here. The stay was great. The room was large. The kitchen had everything we needed and although the breakfast was simple, it met our needs. I loved opening the patio door to let in the sound of the ocean and the breeze. The hotel is a bit worn around the edges but considering the price, I'm not going to complain! The equipped kitchen allowed us to save money.No roaches, no bedbugs and no other creepie crawlies. I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay in a clean moderate priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: I had the luck in selecting the El Caribe Resort and conf center for a multi weekday stay. I liked the first room I stayed in and was given the same room each weekday stay over several weeks. Clean room, friendly staff, flat screen tv and a continental breakfast you would have expected in a much more expensive franchise hotel. The wifi was great. Saw multiple antennas around the property. Was the fastest online experience at a hotel I've ever had. Like being plugged in at the office. Nice quiet section of the beach. Needed meeting space for a small group of associates. Was nice to take breaks and look out at the beach and the ocean. Reasonable pricing. You don't have to stay at a big franchise hotel to get quality service. A refreshing change.

Reviews.Title: “these bad reviewers are nuts”
Reviews.Author: michaelbrace
Reviews.Content: we went down as a girls week away from husbands, work and kids. There were three of us that were in our party and everyrthing went great. Yes the rooms decor is outdated, BUT the location to beach, the pool all that was great. Can't wait to go again next year with a larger group even. Also looking at going down there in the summer with entire family as well

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel”
Reviews.Author: maggiesalas9
Reviews.Content: I never ever write reviews about hotels and much less negative reviews. I stayed at this hotel for a cheerleading competition. I booked this hotel because all other hotels in the area did not have enough rooms to accommodate our entire team so this was it. I am used to staying at nice hotels but I knew from previous reviews that this hotel was dated so I came prepared. I was actually surprised to see that my room was not as dated as the rest of the rooms in the hotel. I stayed in 1709. The first night went well with no problems. The next morning I made breakfast and sat down to eat. When I finished and got up to wash dishes there were 3 little roaches walking all over the pan and sink. I have a phobia of roaches and needless to say was disgusted. I killed them and immediately called the front desk and asked that my room be fumigated. That was Saturday morning. The room attendants did come and clean and did fumigate. I was gone all day until late that night. Upon walking in to my room at approximately 10 pm there was a roach on the wall of the living room, I killed it. Then there was a roach in the kitchen, I killed it. Another roach in the bathroom, I killed it. Another roach on the wall of the bedroom, I killed it and to top everything off, as my mother pulled the covers to get into bed a roach crawled out of the BED! That was the last straw. I packed up my things and left. We rented a room at the Holiday Inn Express (which I paid less for) 3 miles down and thankfully had no roaches. On Sunday I went to the from desk and asked to speak to the manager and was told the managers do not work weekends and after I told them my problem they did not even apologize and just gave me the managers card and told me to call her on the weekdays. I will never stay here again and will definately never ever recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: OK, the breakfast is not that much, but its free. The El Caribe is right ON the beach, they have their own section right in front of the hotel. Also, two pools for adults and a kiddie pool, and bar-b-que grills. We had an ocean front view and we paid extra for that but it was well worth it. The room was clean, the beds, and the bathroom. You can spend a lot more but you are not going to do much better. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: JRWChattanooga
Reviews.Content: The day before we checked in we ask to see a room. They showed us Room 205. I ask the man that day, "when we return, is Room 205 the type of room we be assigned when we check in? The man at the counter said; "YES". The next day at check in, the women at assigned us a room. I mentioned to her we had been there the day before and were shown RM 205. I ask her if the room she just assigned us was a comparable room. She indicated that it was. Upon entering the room we were assigned - to our surprise - this room was nothing like the room we had been shown the day before. I went back to the checkin counter, and I ask her if there had been some mistake? Knowing I specifically ask her if this we were being assigned was like the room we were shown the day before....Almost immediately she became defensive, raised her voice, and then told me; "because we booked online, we did not qualify for the type of were shown the day before". I objected and she became more upset and got even louder. By this time there was a line of peole behind me. She showed no regard for me or for them, and continue her verbal assult. Once again I objected to the"bait and switch" tactics" they had used to prevent us from canceling the day before. Due to the fact that we booked online there was a 24 notice cancellation clause. Now at checkin, inspite of the fact the "bait and switch" was taking place, we could not cancel. If we did we would not receive a refund. It ended up, after I stood my ground and stood there silently for 20-25 minutes, with other guests waiting to check in, she assigned us a room like the one we were shown the day before. WITH ONE EXCEPTION, we had to forfeit the kitchen. We took the room without a kitchen, and ate all of our meals out that week - the additional expense was significant, and our experience was not a good one. In addition, we arose very early every morning and we sat on the balcony overlooking the pool area. The entire 6 days we stayed at this hotel, the pool area was sprayed down "one time". The lounge chairs were washed off "one" time. Although they went around each morning and picked up the towles and obvious trash left in the pool area, it was never cleaned. The attendant did test the water each day. The hallways in the hotel were NEVER cleaned, and one of two elevators did not work the entire time we were there. The continential breakfast; ceral, packaged fruit filled pastries and yogurt, oj and coffee... if you were one of the late arrivng guests, they ran out of things. The coffee was cold each morning as well.... Speaking of coffee, the kind you make in your room. They suppiled that in our room only 2 out of the 6 days we stayed. In spite of the fact I asked for coffee and even left a note asking for coffee one day. The El Caribe Resort and Conference Center at Daytona Beach is an old, very average or below hotel; and at least one of their checki in staff needs customer service training!!! One of the very few bright spots at this hotel is a middle aged man who works very long hours there. He was the kindest man, very helpful, and a model empoyee.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "Customer Service"”
Reviews.Author: vinman566
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a couple of days on the beach. We have stayed at many upscale properties in Daytona and while this hotel is not upscale they make it up with treating you the way you should be treated. The hotel itself is an older beach hotel as expected. They have done their best to keep it maintained. We had a king efficiency with 2 roll away beds for the kids. The furnishings were a bit dated as was the kitchenette, however for its age the place was very clean. The king bed slept well. There was a small table to eat with 2 chairs and a fridge, oven/ stove as well as microwave. A good supply of pots, pans and utensils was available as well. The bathtub / toilet was small (very small) with a sink / vanity area, as expected for the age of the hotel. Once again everything worked and the place was clean. The view from our 4th flr balcony was great. Typical Florida beachview. The 2 pools were cleaned daily and there was a nice variety of picnic, sundecks and grassy sitting areas to enjoy the nice weather. They also have 2 barbeques to use. The thing I like the most was this place had the feel of a mom and pop motel. The staff were all very warm and sincere and would do whatever to make you feel valued. Breakfast was a continental style so do not expect eggs benedict or the like. Bagel, danish, coffee, cereal etc... A must visit if you have a quiet family type trip in mind. I must say The El Caribe has catapulted to the top of were I would like to stay when visiting Daytona. Hope you visit is as well as ours

Reviews.Title: “We had a terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: RobCodger
Reviews.Content: If you're a fan of older properties (and I am) then you will love the El Caribe. I have no idea how old it is.. but I love quirky elevators. They have at least two and maybe more. It's right on the beach and we had a nice view of the ocean. We had a couple of great sunrises and I was treated to some porpoises (dolphins?) out feeding just off the shore. We were about 2.5 miles from the center of Daytona Beach. We thought that might be a detriment but in the end, we were glad to be away from the noise and congestion. We had a one bedroom 'suite' with a MONSTER sized bedroom and an equally large main living area. Our kitchenette was adequate (no decent knife, I'm glad I brought one) and a private balcony that over looked the beach and two swimming pools. Everything was clean and tidy... the beds comfy and the whole place was very livable. The doors have swelled some over time and can be a challenge to close, especially if you're trying not to wake kids early in the a.m. They provide a continental breakfast, but I don't go for that sort of thing. I had a juice one morning and that was fine by me. I'm not one for swimming so I didn't check either of the pools out. We did have a lunch at one of the covered tables out back. There are two shuffleboard lanes and a hoops court in a parking lot. All in all a nice layout. With a Winn Dixie right across the street the location was nice too. A mini golf place too. We could not have been more pleased with the the facility. The elevators might have moved a bit faster but this is NOT a new building. I prefer the older places anyway. Did I mention the size of their one bedroom rooms? You don't get that in a newer property. I'd go back cheerfully... maybe next spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: anhellica1979
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the other reviews that it's a little dated. Pulling up to the building I cringed a bit and expected the worst. But we were pleasantly suprised! There are 2 pools, clean and great for the kids. There's shuffleboard and basketball. The grounds are clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were fine. We had a balcony to the ocean with a beautiful sunrise. I really loved the fact that we were off the main drag, about 2 miles south of the Boardwalk. So we didn't get the spring break crowds or rowdiness. There's mini golf across the street, a few steps to the beach - really, I couldn't complain at all. Would stay here again and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Customers are not No. 1 at this place!”
Reviews.Author: Louise R
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a room for March 22 2012 over a month before. I called several days before arriving and asked for confirmation of a nice room with an ocean view and a kitchenette. Upon our arrival, we watched a "regular" get a room and we were then assigned a room...When we started the disgusting walk to the room, we noticed the elevator was filthy and slow, and this was just the start of it. We walked in the room, and were greeted with a distinct mould smell. We noticed the fridge was filthy, and I think the bedspreads were purchased in 1950 and never replaced! We proceeded to the balcony and the 2 provided chairs were completely rusted, and as an added bonus, the balcony overlooked 4 loud air conditioning units! The bathroom was complete with a shelf with paint peeling and wood exposed and I wouldn't bathe my pet in the bath. We went to the office and although the staff was polite we were told no other units were available. So we know now that if you're not a regular you then get what we called the dungeon rooms! We went back to our room to call the site where we booked this room and our phone didn't work, no dial tome!!! I could see, that the part of the hotel with the air balloons on the wall should be demolished and we never got a chance to "see" any other part of the hotel, where I could understand where the "positive" comments come from. We went back to the front desk and asked to use their phone where we finally got great service from the booking site and got some great customer service. As I walked away, I heard a faint, ....we apologize....Really??? not even a reason for the apology! and I know the manager was not sitting far away, and never came to talk to us. So make sure that if you absolutely have to stay there you don't get the filthy part of the so called resort, with the air balloons and book with a trusted site not directly with the hotel so you can get some help and great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated but good”
Reviews.Author: Ruby0101
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the El Caribe during the 2012 Daytona 500 weekend (Feb 24 - Feb 28). We rented a car so we parked in the ample parking lot right outside of the hotel. Both check-in and check-out were very simple and the staff was courteous. We were given key cards to our room which was located on the 1st floor, right on the ocean. Our room was located in the corner of the hotel, so it seemed a bit scary walking to our room at night as you could not see around the bend. As you walk into the room you could see that the kitchen area was outdated (especially the stove), but who goes on vacation expecting to cook in their hotel room? The kitchen however did serve its purpose. We bought snacks and beverages from the Winn Dixie across the street and were able to store them in the fridge. The kitchen had a toaster, which we did use, to toast our free bagels from breakfast, a microwave and coffee machine (if you wanted to make coffee you needed to bring your own because they don't provide it). It also had pots, pans, dishes and utensils. The shower was powerful and the water was nice and hot. There are plenty of towels but very few toiletries that the hotel provides. Our soap and shampoo didn't get replaced at all even though it was clearly visible that we had used the majority of it. It was a good thing I had my own with me. There is a safe in the room for valuables, which we used on a daily basis, just to be on the safe side. The room was clean. I must admit I did strip down the bed to look for any bedbugs and I was extremely happy to see that I didn't find any red spots on the sheets or bugs in the bed. Our room had a door that led to the outside area where there were two pools and the ocean in front of us...although we didn't get to use them due to the inclement weather, the view was still beautiful. A complimentary breakfast is served every morning. The same items were offered daily which included coffee, tea, juice, cereal, individually wrapped plain bagels, cream cheese, jelly, donuts, yogurt and bananas. Overall, the hotel needs some updates, but it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “On the beach, but very dated”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: It was very nice to be right on the ocean. Lots of rec activities with 2 pools (one heated), shuffleboard, basketball, and jet ski rentals out at the beach. The rooms were very dated and had an old, dirty kind of feel due to the need for upkeep...chipped paint, stuck doors, ripped carpet, linens not very fresh/clean feeling. Decent value though. Our room had a kitchenette (with very old appliances) and a balcony. With so many other choices on the Daytona strip, I don't think I would ever stay here again unless there were some major refurbishments/renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Retro”
Reviews.Author: MCGM6820
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in January 2012. Sort of 70's beach retro. Our ocean front room was clean with a balcony. Room had a fridge and a microwave. Good value, friendly staff and free wi-fi. Free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views and room”
Reviews.Author: Travellingpants
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Dec 2011, the room was great, bathroom clean and it also had a kitchenette, parking and with a oceanview, very nice. The complimentary breakfast only had bagels and pastries and most of these ran out by 8:30 or so though the bkfst time is still 9:30, so if you came later, you had to go hungry. Would be good if they could provide coffee packs in the room as they had a coffeemaker.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more !”
Reviews.Author: Jennyyyy54
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place ! Check in & out was a breeze and made that way by Nicole working the front desk. I booked on hotels.com and got an ocean facing room with 2 queen beds, kitchenette and a balcony and all this for $ 48 ! Room was clean, roomy and well equipped. Breakfast was more than adequate with coffee, tea, juice, milk, yogurt, cereal, fruit, bagels & danish.There are 2 pools along with a kiddy pool. It's in a handy location with a Winn Dixie across the street and a 7/11 a couple blocks away. I can't wait to return !!!

Reviews.Title: “wedding of my daughter”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: service and staff were great. Best I've ever had. Anything we needed they all worked with us. Robin, thanks so much....

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Alex E
Reviews.Content: We had a group of over 120 guests and the staff was extremely helpful and accommodating! The rooms were great and always clean. We had a great time and would definitely go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cboyd_10
Reviews.Content: Although we only live across the bridge in Port Orange, we go regularly to El Caribe for long weekends. Yes, I know it is an older property but it is always spotlessly clean. How many times can you spill something on the kitchen floor and find no dirt when you wipe up the spill. I can't even do that in my kitchen at home!!! The staff is the most dedicated I have ever seen. They go out of their way to insure your stay is perfect. From the folks at the front desk to the cleaning people to the maintenance staff, they all want you to enjoy your stay. The view is fantastic no matter what room you stay in. Sunrises from your balcony and Sunsets from the deck on the 4th floor. Who could ask for more. We will be returning soon for our next getaway.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: JUSPEACHY11
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Daytona Beach and had a LOVELY stay at the El Caribe. My room was very clean & the staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was a plus and the view was amazing. I really enjoyed my stay & will definately stay there again the next time I am in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Hosted a bike tour and the cyclists still talk about the location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: H2Girl
Reviews.Content: El Caribe hosted the training week of our group of 15+ people for the She's My Sister Bike Tour (http://shesmysisterbiketour2011.blogspot.com/) in May 2011. The entire staff, from the general manager to reservations to front desk to housekeeping, were helpful and supportive. Not only did the staff help us during the week, but they came out to say goodbye to the cyclists as they biked away towards Portland, ME. Thank you everyone! A shout-out especially to Robin and Portia for your patience, kindness and support.

Reviews.Title: “The best beach wedding EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ladyangleraut
Reviews.Content: I wanted to say thank you to the management and staff of the hotel! I had my wedding there on August 13th, 2011 and it was the most amazing day of my life. Not only did I marry my best friend but you made it so beautiful! The courtyard was the perfect place for the wedding even though it sprinkled a little bit and the banquet room was just stunning. To have my reception in such a beautiful room was like living out the dream that all young girls have. Everyone was so accomodating and made sure that I was stress-free on that day. I would definitely tell anyone looking to do a beach wedding that the El Caribe is the #1 spot in all of Daytona Beach! The location was perfect and as an added bonus the room we stayed in had the greatest view I have ever seen. Staying there with our 4 children for our wedding, I thought was going to be crowded, but the size of this room was very surprising. Everything is beautiful about this place!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rod F
Reviews.Content: Room was older but very clean. Beds were very comfortable. No complaints on anything. Ocean front rooms, beautiful view. Staff was always friendly. Groceries, other amendities were all within walking distance. TV had first rate movies. No restaurant on site but continental breakfast was provided every day.

Reviews.Title: “ROMANCE GETAWAY”
Reviews.Author: DALE M
Reviews.Content: The front desk was excellent and the service was good. The room was facing the ocean and it was nice to see the ocean early in the mornings. The only negative was that the front door had to be slammed hard to close. Everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: grouchee
Reviews.Content: Nice moderately priced hotel on the beach. The room we stayed in was very comfortable,Beds were good, spacious room with full kitchen w/dining room table and seating for four. The oceanfront view was great, nice pool area, seemed to be kept up decent,they cleaned deck and pool early in a.m.. The pools finish on the bottom had been patched and could see , but still nice. The staff were very pleasant at check in, Housekeeping staff was pleasant. This is not a ritz , but very nice place to stay. [older resort,good to enjoy the beach]

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz Carlton, but an OK stay.”
Reviews.Author: Amy G
Reviews.Content: This is an older property that is fairly well maintained. This was the only property that could confirm we could get two rooms adjacent to each other...and they were. Rooms are OK....very spacious. Great view of a beautiful beach. I was told on the phone parking was free. I had to sign a statement acknowledging I knew their rules including the fact that a second car would be charged.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: pitter13
Reviews.Content: My family had a large suite with plenty of room for my elderly mother's walker to get round in. We loved that we had a gorgeous view of the beach. The family enjoyed 2 pools and shuffle board daily. Each morning we had a continental breakfast and then lunch in the kitchenette in our room. It was so convenient for our large family to have meals in our room and a store (Winn Dixie) across the street. Great time was had by all and we can't wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel and pools right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Paul8581
Reviews.Content: We were met by a very friendly staff and greeted throughout our stay on our recent family vacation. The hotel is on the beach but also has 2 well maintained clean pools. We felt secure and welcome here. The rooms were very nice and spacious with an unbelievable view. The grocery store was right across the street and the rooms had a full size refrigerator and a stove. A well stocked continental breakfast also was a big money saver for families. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “we will return as soon as possible”
Reviews.Author: exterminate98
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel. The staff was very friendly. When we arrived we discovered our refrigerator was not cooling. Within 10 minutes of reporting it a maintenance man was at our door to replace it. There are 2 pools and a kiddie pool. The continental breakfast was great. There was cereal, fruit, donuts, pastries, coffee and orange juice. The hotel is older but clean. It is not in the busy part of town but has restaurants and is across the street from winn dixie. The elevator is slow but we did not mind. We had booked a ocean front room but were upgraded to an effeciency. That was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: firstborn_2006
Reviews.Content: We checked into the El Caribe 7/22 and discovered room #502 and 504 had bed bugs. I immediately went downstairs to tell the front desk clerk who could care less. We checked out immediately. Some of my friends stayed there as well their rooms were just okay. i probably would never stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty rough around the edges”
Reviews.Author: VbrKnoxville
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty rough around the edges. It was clean, but pretty tired. It is an older property and the management has made some attempts to freshen it up, but the repairs weren't done very well. The room seemed to have been recently painted, but badly. The plumbing is absolutely ancient. The toilet (in the same tiny, enclosed space as the bathtub/shower) was similar to the basic tankless versions found in rest stops and filling station restrooms. Breakfast was included with the room. It was very basic. Cold cereal, juice, pre-packaged bagels, basic fruit and yogurt. The layout of the hotel was good. All of the rooms were oriented with views of the ocean. The one thing that was difficult to get past, however, was its exterior color scheme. Maybe they were trying for a tropical look, but the colors were definitely not tropical. The entire building (six floors) was painted a lime sherbet green and the doors to the rooms were painted the color of orange sherbet. Then, to make it even worse, there were giant neon hot-air balloons attached to the outside walls facing the street. We were speaking with a realtor and when she asked us where we were staying, I was too embarrassed to tell her. Not cool...

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Megan_LP
Reviews.Content: Got a great last minute deal for this hotel. Right on the beach, so it was nice that we didn't have to pay for parking. Studio style room included full fridge, microwave, coffee maker, stove, sink, toaster, and dishware as well as pots and pans. Only downside was that we were given any small amounts of coffee. Not on the main strip of Daytona Beach but definitely not far from it; in one day we managed to go to the beach and drive to this area at least three times.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and nasty hygiene!”
Reviews.Author: notpicky78
Reviews.Content: Please take heed. I have been here in the past for 1 night only a couple of times back years ago when I lived in FL. So, we returned because it's cheap and for the memories, but I will never come back! Note: I have not ever felt the need to write a place up, but this one is def. necessary. We had a nice efficiency room for our large family and our friends who were with us had their own efficiencies. After several nights, I was very itchy on my legs and back. I figured it was the mix of salt water, sand, and chlorine making these small itchy patches. Then, I found the culprit. An engorged bed bug walking across my bed after his night time feeding. The front desk tried telling me someone before us must have brought a dog in and it was a tick or flea. Considering one of our friends that was with us works with animal control and is very familiar with what a flea and tick looks like, we laughed that off. They moved us to a new room and steamed our clothes, but said they could do nothing for our luggage! So I guess we're taking those in cases home with us and moving them with us to our next room? The hygiene comes into play when the maid is cleaning our room. I noticed she puts on latex gloves in takes the trash out and dirty towels. When she enters the bathroom and messes with the toilet, she then placed a blue glove on. Apparently, the toilet wasn't flushing very well and mentioned that to me. So still wearing the latex gloves and the blue toilet glove on top, she begins to make my children's bed! Seriously, that is so foul and you wonder how bed bugs could have arrived in such a clean place huh?

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, and looked like a war zone.”
Reviews.Author: CMMKED
Reviews.Content: We were so sad to find that one of the pools was closed and an area was taped up blocking one of the two paths to the beach. We were allowed to use the pools at the hotel next door but figured we would have been better off to stay at that hotel. We had such high hopes based on the reviews here. The service folks are anything but polite. We have a small child. The hotel elevator is so slow it takes about 20-30 seconds between floors. We were trying to go to the 7th floor the other day and literally were pushed to the back of the elevator to make room for hotel staff. I would think someone would have trained them that the customer should come first. One of the staff actually rode up to go down, making the crowd a bit too much for us. We used the stairs from the 3rd floor up. I think we would have given the place a 3 if the manager had even remotely acted like she cared. I supposed the place would get a 3 if there hadn't been so much of a mess. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, but very old”
Reviews.Author: travlgrl39
Reviews.Content: The main thing to understand about this hotel is that it is very old. If the age doesn't bother you, then this would be a very adequate hotel. It is extremely clean and right on the water. This is actually an old motel where the rooms all open from exterior doors. When I say old, for example, the toilets are industrial...they are the same you would find in your local public schools. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: sabralps
Reviews.Content: While not in walking distance to the boardwalk and related areas, it was a great find. It is an older hotel (weird green color with hot air balloons on it) but, it is clean, well stocked and spacious. It has a pool area for adults (not specified) and a second pool with an adjacent kiddy pool. It has a nice lawn area with tables, grills and space for multiple families or a large reunion. There is direct gate access to the beach and a basketball area. Our room was ocean front with a private balcony. I was very pleased since I booked it primarily based on the comments on here. I recommended it to a friend who has now booked a room for next weekend. If you want value and a comfy place to stay this is it......

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: sacko36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week and found nothing to complain about (not that we were looking for anything). The rooms were serviced daily and all of the staff we met were friendly and welcoming. The views over the beach are everything you would have hoped for

Reviews.Title: “it was a very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: maxbunnell
Reviews.Content: For an older hotel, it was very peaceful and nice. The room was very clean, the shower was nice and hot, lots of amenities, and the grounds were kept very clean. There was a cheerleading convention in town, but it didn't bother our stay at all. The staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dated”
Reviews.Author: blacktaffy2003
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right on beach with lovely view if you have sea view balcony room. Bed was comfy and large. Everything else is negative, dated and tiny bathroom, scruffy kitchen, external corridors, broken floor tiles, shabby decor. Breakfast is cornflakes and donuts. No hot water on one day. The locals tell me that this one of the cleanest beach front hotels as some of the other hotels do not get cleaned daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price but 3 stars? Nahhh”
Reviews.Author: herethereneverywhere
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location- right on the water- and has features like a full size refrigerator, microwave and stove which is great if you are spending a week or longer (we weren't) but the property is a remnant from the early 60's and while fairly well maintained it is definitely is showing its age. If you can get a room on the water- there aren't many but it's worth it. The view was spectacular- the room was right on the ocean with spectacular sunrise and sunset views- - and having a deck you can sit on makes it even more special. Unfortunatety coming back into the room brings you back to reality. The rooms are painted a bright yellow- yes, yellow- and have nothing on the walls. There is aluminum foil lining the drip pans on the stove that hasn't been changed in a while- yuck. The bathroom was tiny and cramped and definitely in need of an upgrade from the low flow shower head on down. While spartan best describes the room, the bed was comfortable and cable worked so...for what was paid (<$50) for a weekend night it was a very good value. Much more than that and I would think twice though.... I didn't get to eat the included continental breakfast but it was fairly generous consisting of fresh fruit cereal, donuts, yogurt and such which many seemed to focus on. The staff is very helpful and friendly as well If you are looking for a good cheap getaway then this is it. Hotwire, Orbitiz and others can get you the best deal. It you are looking for a 3 star resort comparable to Holiday Inn, Hyatt, or Hampton Inns or serious conference center this probably wouldn't be my first choice unless you are on a serious budget..

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a view !! Amazing value, wish we were here another day.”
Reviews.Author: shecheersipay
Reviews.Content: My kids and I were thrilled when we opened our room to have a georgeous view of the ocean. The room was very large and had everything needed to enjoy our stay. Full size refrig, stove and oven, micro, coffe maker. If I knew how great it was I would have booked another night in this room. The weather wasn't warm enough for us to use the pools but there was a heated and regular pool and they looked nice. We really got a deal and were very pleased. The bathroom could be bigger and updated but the actual living quarters were super. We didn't make it down to breakfast so I don't know how that was but both Ramesy and Derek were very helpful as well as the girls at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Beach Motel”
Reviews.Author: angelbear425
Reviews.Content: Stayed here both in August 2009 and then in August/September 2010. It is a great value hotel in Daytona Beach Shores (different from Daytona Beach). It is farther south and away from the crowded main beach and boardwalk area. I really like staying in DBS as opposed to DB because it is much more quiet. The rooms were adequate and there was everything that I needed, including a laundry area. Continental breakfast was included: cereal, bagels, pastries, toast, yogurt, and homemade donuts, along with coffee, milk, and juices. There are 2 pools, which was nice because if one was packed the other was available. My vacation is 2009 went without a hitch and never had a problem. It was quiet and relazing. The views were amazing! I stayed over Labor Day weekend this year (2010) and I know I will never stay the same weekend again. There was one family that rented out the entire hotel for a reunion except for a few rooms (mine, the one next to mine, and a few others). They were complete pigs! They threw their garbage everywhere. On the grounds, in the pools, on the beach, everywhere they were there was garbage (including used condoms). They blasted music all day/night. We went to complain at the desk several times, but they refused to do anything about it. There are hours for the pools that stated they were to be used from 6a-11p, but they used until all hours of the night making noise and screaming. Security just stood there and watched- I honestly believe that he was afraid. After the family left the hotel went back to being immacualtely clean and quite- just like the previous year. I left something in my room and they even mailed it back to me (granted, it took them 2.5 months to mail it, but I did get it back). All in all it's a quite, clean, beach motel and I will stay here again.. Just not during Labor Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in area”
Reviews.Author: Moceangirl
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly the manager Porcha very professional. I had a situation and she was very helpful because she know the area. This is my first review (shame on me) I have been staying at this hotel fir two years whenever I have business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific view at a quiet, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: grrbear_ca
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the El Caribe - first stay was their basic hotel room, second stay was their one bedroom suite, and this time we tried the one bedroom jacuzzi suite. We keep coming back because we haven't been disappointed yet! Both the bedroom and the living/dining area in the jacuzzi suite have outstanding views of the ocean, with large bay windows that go floor-to-ceiling. The wrap-around balcony provides views of the ocean to the east and to the south, with plenty of room to stretch out and find the sun. The suite is so spacious that it could easily accommodate five or six people without feeling cramped. The kitchen is handy, although it could use a little more counter space, and the jacuzzi is nice enough but not really necessary. Never used the pool because the beach was right there, and the hotel is in a relatively quiet area of Daytona Beach so it felt like we had the beach to ourselves. Early in our stay the hotel hosted a wedding and reception, but up on the seventh floor we didn't hear a thing despite being directly above the conference room. We saw a lot of Florida plates in the parking lot, which suggests that locals favor the El Caribe as good value and a good stay. The only bad thing I can say about the hotel is that their high speed internet was spotty at best. I can't really imagine any Daytona Beach hotel having a better room that wasn't a timeshare condo, especially not with a kitchen and a large balcony. Next time we'll try the studio apartment suite!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean, clean and great value”
Reviews.Author: luckycanuck73
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the El Caribe and it was a great experience. It is an older property, but is kept in fantastic shape. Most importantly it was very very clean. Great location further south down the beach, in a quiet area, with a Winn Dixie across the street and an IHOP and pizza place almost across the street. My room had a fridge, coffee maker, and microwave, and a private balcony with two chairs and a table, and a great view of the ocean. They had a basic free breakfast, coffee, juice, cereal, danish, muffins, bagels, etc. Everything was very fresh, and there is a nice seating area. Plenty of free parking. Very reasonable rates. The front desk staff, especially Portia, were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It would be great for families as they have a basketball court, shuffleboard, propane grills, volleyball court, all next to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: popson2k
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well priced with the free breakfast thrown in. I stayed there with my wife for 10 days and we really enjoyed it. Staff were polite and helpful. Ramesh (one of the front house officer) was particularly very helpful and always welcoming. He gave us all the local information and was really excellent with the guests. He recommended that we regularly check out El Caribe website for excellent offers. We're thinking of our next booking already!! Highly recommended. Idris (London)

Reviews.Title: “Good value with all plenty of amenities”
Reviews.Author: timb075043
Reviews.Content: We stayed in DB because Titesville was booked on a trip to watch the Space Shuttle. The S.S. got scrubbed that week, but we still had a good time. Ocean front room with a great view, hotel has lots of things to do and is well placed on Atlantic Blvd. Ramesh and all staff at the front desk were very helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you're traveling with a family with children. You could probably spend the whole stay without leaving the hotel if you wanted. Many rooms have kitchens and there's a grocery store across the street. There's several pools along with other things on the property and rentals are right on the beach for golf carts, 4-wheelers and jet skis.

Reviews.Title: “It was really nice.”
Reviews.Author: kathyd1122
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, nice and friendly staff. We had a beautiful oceanfront view. Ramesh took excellent care of us. We be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: munchkinmommie
Reviews.Content: As always, El Caribe was wonderful. Great location, staff (Bob and Ramsey!) and fantastic physical plant. The rooms are great, esp the new beds. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “great quiet location, older motel style”
Reviews.Author: TMR1516
Reviews.Content: I do not stay in the room the entire time on my vacations so it was fine for my travels. I stayed in the older section of the hotel, it was outdated and there were metal blinds in the shower...but, the location is perfect for a beach weekend. The hotel is far enough from the larger tourist section to be quiet but close enough if you want to be in the busy section of Daytona Beach. The staff was friendly and helpful and all the bugs were outside... so that is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Could not stay so bad!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimloliver
Reviews.Content: Me and my family made reservation to stay at this hotel on 10/08/2010. We had reservation for the 3 nights 4 days. However upon arriving to the hotel locate by road construction, my husband asked to see the room. We paid for a oceanview room! When we arrived to the room it had a awful smell. The suppose oceanview was a ocean view out the corner of your eye. The night staff was great and understanding about my family not wanting to stay at the hotel. I was told that I need to speak to the manager in the day time. Called the staff in thew morning and they were completely rude! Not a good hotel, it looks nothing like the pictures! AWFUL....

Reviews.Title: “Great and relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Longeen
Reviews.Content: Great vacation at the El Caribe resort. We have been vacationing at this location for about 5-6 years so far, and it is always great stay. Rooms are clean, staff people very friendly.Guys like Ramesh, will not hesitate to walk the extra mile for you. Thank you El Caribe!

Reviews.Title: “Mom and Daughter getaway”
Reviews.Author: KathyVOcala_Florida
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying the night at the El Caribe Hotel. The hotel is one of the older hotels but it is very well maintained and Clean. There were 3 pools, shuffle board, basketball court, BBQ grills, volley ball on the beach. So much for a family. The beach was wonderful and grocery store across the street. Our room had a full kitchen and all rooms had a balcony. It was a laid back setting with friendly people and staff. Romesh was sure we would have a great time and he was right. Lesha helped us to get a late check out so we could enjoy the beach and pool all day on Sunday! The continental breakfast had plenty of fruits, bagels, danishes and cereal and the staff was great. The price of the room was great too. Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Nice Place - Cell Phones Signal Awful”
Reviews.Author: Sissybufu
Reviews.Content: Did a 3 night stay here and was surprised at how much nicer it was then I thought. I had booked a court room and was upgraded to a ocean front. I stayed in the south tower on the ground floor. I don't recommend staying on the ground floor. I was able to see the ocean but the security flood lights shine right into the room and in your face when you are sitting on the porch. Also sprinkler system come on around midnight and is loud and stays on until 6:30 am. The sprinklers get all the chairs wet so you have to dry them off before you can use them. The continental breakfeast was good. Opens up at 6:30 am had coffee, tea, juice, yogurt, cereal, beagles, doughnuts, danishes, oranges and bananas. The room was comfortable. The beds were nice and soft. The towels looked new and clean. The shower worked good. The staff was friendly. Even the old guy up at the front desk that other reviews have discussed tried his best to seem like he cared about my complaint and stay. The first night i killed 2 palmetto bugs in the room. I put one of them in a plastic cup and brought it to the front desk to ask them what it was. They offered to come and spray my room right away. Being from Florida I understand that palmetto bugs will fly into your room the second you open the door. There are 2 pools and that was nice. There was a large youth group there and they stayed in one pool and the other less rowdy guest used the other pool, There is a security officer that patrols the grounds so I felt safe. CELL RECEPTION IS AWFUL IN OR AROUND YOUR ROOM!!! I had no service the entire time I was there. I had to take my phone out onto the beach to get and/or send texts and calls. For an older inexpensive hotel it was nice and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda42
Reviews.Content: The service was great. From the front desk to the maids.If we needed anything in the room or if we wanted them to recommend a place to eat. Our room was awesome. Nice and clean, had ocean front view from every window. The best vacation I'd ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Our yearly get together was super.”
Reviews.Author: GOOD11
Reviews.Content: Thankyou for the wonderful two day weekend you provided our large family. Clean, roomy and very helpful staff. Especially Robin for helping with everything we asked for. The Buchanan Family, Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge it by the outstide appearence...overall wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: SWEETCANDY159
Reviews.Content: When I first pulled up, I thought "great this is gonna be a roach motel...". Its not as big and fancy as some of the other hotels, however i must add there are much worse! IThe hotel looks a little run down from the outside and is painted a bright lime green, (however, when your on the beach its easy to spot!) The first staff members I encountered were very friendly. When I checked in, they upgraded my room to a full kitchen. The kitchen saved a lot of money on food. There is a grocery store right accross the street. I had an oceanfront room on the first floor. The veiw of the ocean really sucked from my room, but I had 2 small children, so the lower level turned out to be very conveinet for me. I thought the room was very nice. Judging from the outside appearence of the hotel, I did not expect it to be as nice. The room was very spacious and clean. The room was comfortable. I will say that the beds were a little firm for me, but other than that absolutely no complaints on the room. The continetial breakfast is not great, unless you like expired milk.I tried to make a male staff member aware of this issue and he told me "he does not deal with that, he works at the front desk" obviously guest concerns are not his priority. He is a total jerk, avoid him if you can (White male, tan complexion mid 50's with grey hair). Also I would like to point out that the internet does not work here, I was unable to maintain a connection. Once again, jerk at front desk was not helpful with this issue. Other than that I enjoyed my stay. The hotel has a great location, right across the street from a grocery store and putt putt. The pool was very nice. There are also picnic tables and grills with a great view of the ocean. I had a wonderful stay with the exception of one staff member. *** Basically, if your not looking to spend a whole lot of money, but want a decent room on the ocean, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Cands2
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a tour group for the NASCAR race so didn't choose this hotel, but were very pleased. We were given a wonderful corner room with a great view of the beach, pool, and grounds. Though it's an older, smaller hotel,right on the beach, the room was clean and comfortable, had a full-size fridge and microwave; the staff was excellent; breakfast was more than adequate and very well cared for and we would definitely stay there again. Skip the IHOP across the street and eat at Tiki Bills at the Perry resort nearby - great breakfast and lunch and great prices. For dinner and drinks (or breakfast buffet) go to Trader's at the Aku Tiki Best Western also nearby. All this and a Winn-Dixie across from the hotel makes it a perfect place to stay (especially if you don't have a car there)

Reviews.Title: “This was our 24th year staying here and we signed up for next year before we left.”
Reviews.Author: lls11
Reviews.Content: this is a lovely hotel on the ocean with large, clean rooms with kitchenettes. The location is near grocery stores, restaurants, post office, ice cream stores, etc. The beach is lovely and it has 2 swimming pools. It has a family atmosphere. All of the employees were very helpful. Since it is located in Daytona Beach Shores, it is only a short drive to Orlando, St. Augustine, Kennedy Space Center, and many other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was mixed”
Reviews.Author: ashleystebbins
Reviews.Content: My husband and i snuck away for one last night before we had our baby (so i was 9 mo pregnant). We asked for a queen bed w ocean view but was "upgraded" to 2 double murphy beds and a partial view but a larger room. i would have much rather slept on comfortable, larger beds than having a larger room. we should have told them no thanks on the upgrade. I liked that there was 2 pools, one was quite and warm while the other had lots of families around and places to BBQ. There was not a lot of people on the beach compared to other parts, which was nice. and the staff seemed to be friendly enough. There was nothing really bad about the hotel but neither was there anything great. I think we were both glad to get back and get some sleep. For the price, i would say there are better hotels in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CentralFloridian
Reviews.Content: The affordable rates and prime location make the El Caribe an excellent choice for family outings and small business meetings. The staff are friendly and easy to work with. A small welcome bouquet of flowers was waiting in our room, which was a very nice touch. The front reception desk staff are well organized and friendly. Our rooms were ready well before the 4 pm check in guarantee. The El Caribe is not fancy, but it is a great place to take a group or family on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay... felt like home.”
Reviews.Author: snpendle
Reviews.Content: The staff are some of the nicest people in the world. Extremely friendly and helpful. Great service. Very clean, awesome views of the ocean, located near everything. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and pleasurable vacation o the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Sis095
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and wanted to book a beach holiday. El Caribe was the perfect spot for my group. The service was exceptional begining with the Director of Sales. The hotel was clean and accomodating in every way. The view from evey roomwas spectacular of the beach. It as an awesome experience, of which we plan to make an annual event.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we found this place!!”
Reviews.Author: aggiegreeneyes
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about what to expect here after reading the reviews, but we were so happy during our stay at El Caribe!! The staff was always friendly and helpful, our room was very clean and comfortable, and the view was amazing! All the rooms have a balcony overlooking the ocean, so we spent the mornings sitting out there watching the sun come up over the atlantic. The kitchen was a little outdated, but that didnt really bother us. The only thing we thought could make this place better would be a hot tub! So overall if you only like staying in name brand hotels this might not be the place for you, but I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a place right on the beach at a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: JBrunno
Reviews.Content: Loved the ocean view from the room. The decor was a little dated and I found it was quite noisy. But once i put the ear plugs in it wasn't too bad. The outside facilities were kept quite clean and our room wasn't too bad either. Not a bad deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here”
Reviews.Author: azure5707
Reviews.Content: While I did get a pretty good deal on the price this place was definitely not worth it. The staff there were very friendly and helpful at any hour and the location to the beach is great, I could look at the beach from my bed. But those were the only good things about this place. The room was in need of major repair, very rundown and just appeared out dated. It was damp, moldy, squashed bugs on the walls, and a spider in my bed. There also isn't a whole lot in the immediate vicinity except IHOP and Winn Dixie. I was also very concerned by the lack of security. There are no deadbolts on the doors and a maintenance guy walked into my room as I was unpacking (with the door locked). The outside areas are quite deserted at night and I did not see a camera in sight around the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel could use some upgrades.”
Reviews.Author: RickyN66
Reviews.Content: The key thing to this hotel as others have stated is to stay in the south tower. It is the newest part of the hotel but is in no way new. The staff was friendly & helpful. The view was fantastic and I got a group rate so it was very affordable. I would recommend this hotel for someone that wants to stay on the beach for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Always Clean, Oceanfront rooms, Heated Pool”
Reviews.Author: atmobeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the South Tower for the month of December. We had stayed at other Daytona resorts but they were in need of renovations and were basically unliveable. We were impressed with the room...very clean and the view is fantastic...I can't say enough about the staff...from the front desk, to maintenace, to housekeeping...they are all so professional, helpful and friendly...you pick up the phone and someone is at your door in minutes. They all make you feel like your business is appreciated and they want you to come back....we plan on returning again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, yucky rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Belgium3boys
Reviews.Content: The location is great; right on the beach. Has 2 pools and a baby pool. A refrigerator in the room. Rooms are not great. Damp feeling in carpet and room, dated, and mold/mildew on the walls. Bathroom is small. Even found mold/mildew spots on the bedspreads and on one of the pillows (underneath the pillowcase). Would not recommend due to the health issues.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: jandlmaui
Reviews.Content: Don't think twice about this place. The staff was friendly BUT the hotel itself is a dump. We had seen four rooms before we chose one. We paid for an oceanfront room and they kept showing us a dirty rooms and rooms with an oceanview. The bathrooms were very small we couldnt close the door. The one pool was closed as soon as we got there because of fieces in the pool. The door to the room banged all night due to the ocean breeze. We have stayed many times in Daytona and this place is just awful. DO not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not the prettiest hotel, but still great.”
Reviews.Author: DaveC64
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is not quite as its website would have you believe. We came to Daytona on the 12th day of our trip around Florida, and found that Daytona itself isn't exactly what we'd expected - after the rush of Orlando, it felt like grinding to a halt, as Daytona Beach is a very quiet, almost elderly feeling place. Coupled with the change of pace, it was disappointing to behold El Caribe - a slightly dilapidated green motel, and it had a van parked outside with workmen doing something with saws whcih didnt help. The scary old lift that took us up to our room didnt help much either. But that's where the dispapointment ended - the room was big, the view was awesome, and the facilities (internet, pool, basketball court, sun loungers, etc) were all easily accessible. The place is literally on the beach, so it was a great place to wake up and wander into the sea... Daytona Beach really isn't the kind of place I'd recommend going for nightlife, so the out of the way location of the hotel is nearly an irrelevant point, but it's worth mentioning that it's about 3 miles from the main shopping area (though it is on the same road). It's near enough to gas stations, a 7-11 and 2 mini golf courses (great fun) though. My one major complaint, ignoring the slightly disappointing look of the hotel, was that the connecting door between our room and the next wasn't fitted very well, so we could hear the screaming brat children next door throughout our stay. We had a great stay here regardless - the perfect way to wind down after Orlando, and the view was great. I'd recommend keeping your stay relatively short though as there's not much beyond mini golf and the beach to occupy you. We had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price, clean room, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gardenladyApharetta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel while in town visiting the grandkids. We enjoyed the easy access to the pool and beach. The breakfast needs some updating, they only have donuts and coffee/tea. Some guests feel it is their right to take as may donuts as they can carry, without regards to the other guests, so get ther early. We will stay there again for Thanksgiving, this will be our hotel from now on. We have tried many others.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: alabamabeachgal
Reviews.Content: El Caribe was actually better than expected. After reading some of the reviews, we were considering canceling our reservation...but decided to tough it out for the price since it was only one night on our way to Miami and the Keys. We were given a nice non-smoking room with a king bed. Our balcony view of the beach was great. Usually, you'll pay alot more for a beach front room! Pool was clean and not crowded. Our biggest complaint was the slow elevators that seemily would hang-up between floors. It kept us a little worried that we might get trapped on them. It appeared that some sections of the Resort were newer than others and I suppose we were in the newest building. It's a good location if you want to be close to a grocery store. Winn Dixie is across the street. Also be sure and try Crabby Joe's Restaurant nearby. The waterfront restaurant (literally in the water) has great food and a nice casual atmosphere... you must try the smoked seafood dip...it's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: FieroAlex
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the El Caribe in late march 2009 for a 7 night stay, we got a great deal on a suite on the 6th floor of the south tower. The price was very good, the room was clean and the staff was friendly. The key to this hotel is to stay in the south tower. The room we had included a private balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean, a jacuzzi tub (very small), a kitchen and a living area. The room's decor was dated however for the price of the room that didn't really make a difference. The only other negative aspect I could find was that there was no guest computer in the lobby for internet access and the location was a little bit far from the boardwalk. I would recommend staying in the south tower of this hotel! There was plenty of parking, 2 pools and direct beach access.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: LLE4
Reviews.Content: This is absolutley the worst hotel I have ever stayed at...honestly. If they offered me money to stay there again, I would not. The property itself is bad, but the rooms are disguisting. The toilets are the kind you would find at a gas station, complete with the tall metal piping and handle. The entire room was gross. Black ants were everywhere. Mold and grime all over. Housekeeping never came and when we called at 4pm to inquire when they were coming, we were told they had all gone home. Too bad for us. My husband called the front desk to ask for a wake-up cal. I swear to you the lady said, "Why are you calling? You can just set your own alarm." My husband asked again and was told they don't really do that, but they would make an exception. Guess what? No wake up call the next morning. I can't express to you how bad this place is. Absolutely disguisting. Again, if they offered me a free week plus cash each day, I would not go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mom215cats
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. They rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was very nice and friendly. We loved being right on the beach! There was a mix up with our reservation we had made online--someone had canceled it. We found this out when we went to check in, but the desk clerk was very nice and helpful, got us our rooms even matched the price we had from our reservation confirmation email! We definitely would stay here again if we get back to Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “There are *2* Pools”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Byte
Reviews.Content: For all those saying the pool isn't heated, you need to use the pool on the OLD side, or stop sniveling and deal. /rant We stayed here 3 nights in december, and no, it's not the newest, or the nicest, but I don't feel I need to spend over $150 for a "nice" room. The room we had was clean, well appointed, had a full ocen view, and the pool we used was heated. We were in the newer twin towers. The elevators are clunky, and I'd hate to have a room on the bottom floor across from the machine room as it's very noisy. But on the 5th, it was nice. We slept with the balcony door open and let the surf lull us to sleep. The bathroom is small, but since I don't live in my bathroom on the road, I didn't mind. There's a liquor store and a pizza joint across the street. The liquor store has soda at a not-too-high price and the pizza, while good, seemed a bit high and took forever. All in all, it was a good mini-vacation, and El Caribe is on our return-to list.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, great ocean view”
Reviews.Author: amybelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El Caribe for two nights and was pleased with the experience. Due to the off season, we were able to get a king efficiency room facing the ocean for $65 per night. We were warned that construction (aka jack hammering) would be occuring during business hours for repairs to the balconies. It really didn't bother my stay at all. It is an older hotel that could use some improvements, for but a couple of nights on the beach, it served my purposes perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Good Value with Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: FamFun4
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised! I am always a bit nervous booking a hotel online that I have never seen before. Especially, when we get such a good deal but we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly. We were meeting another family there and they accomodated us by putting us on the same floor. The room was clean and comfortable. Not new and fancy but definitely clean and comfortable with a small fridge and microwave. We loved the balcony w/chairs over looking the ocean! The pools were nice with plently of loungers. There was some nice green grassy areas with picnic tables. This was nice to see as most hotels are taken up every inch of the property by concrete. The free breakfast was only donuts and coffee but there is a very good IHOP practically across the street. Another plus, for those braving the strong surf, it is close to a lifeguard stand.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel Front Desk Misleading”
Reviews.Author: toohotofachick
Reviews.Content: My Friend came from Altamonte Springs Florida to see me here in Daytona Beach. By the time he got here he didn't feel like making the drive back home so we pulled to the side of the road and started grabbing hotel rates that were cheap. The only one that we found was the El-Caribe Resort and confrence center. I call and speak to the Agent working the front desk and he said the Orgional rate from room 1705 which had no kitchen in the South Tower and just viewed the Ocean was 130.00 so he said being that no one got the room it was going to be 79.00. So he said for the discounted rates we would have to talk to a Manager when we arrived. So we asked for one and was told that they don't give Florida resident rates out last minute. However we were dead tired and weren't going to argue so we go to our room. When we got to the room we noticed that room was nice however within a few hours of being in it i realised why he couldn't pre sell the room and here is why. Their was a huge cob web in the entrance coming from the Balcony Entrance. Pigion Poop All over the out side of the air unit out the room. The bathroom everytime we turned on that light made a constant humming sound. Their is no vending machine on every floor just one. And the chip machine was totaly broken that is on the first floor. And the elevator is slowy going because it kept jolting at every floor it stopped at. Now all in all for 79.00 we got what we paid for but the up to 380.00 what they can get during bike week and the special events isn't worth that price for that amount of money you can look else where and have better service. And a Much cleaner room free of cob webs for 380.00

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price and the view”
Reviews.Author: NH954
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at El Caribe for the past 3 years during Bike Week and Biketoberfest. The deluxe oceanfront rooms have a great view and decent accomdations. If you think you will be walking to Main St, think again, it's several miles (the hotel is actually in Daytona Beach Shores). The beach is not crowded this far south, but there isn't much to look at either. If you are looking for a safe spot, empty beach and a good place to spend time with the family (avoid Bike Week and Spring Break) it's hard to beat. Keep in mind, there is no on-site dining, just a continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel: great value”
Reviews.Author: workoutchiick
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! We were there at a not-so-busy time of the year and it was fabulous. I have read the reviews about this one and most were positive so we tried it as opposed to the others we have stayed in past years. Price was very good and the service was excellent. The elevator in the north tower is working much better since some of the reviewers have stayed. We noticed our balcony door would not lock and they sent maintenance up IMMEDIATELY. The view was perfect from our oceanfront room and the morning coffee and doughnuts were the perfect breakfast for us (saved us a daily trek inland to Dunkin Doughnuts).. Our room was clean and while the bathrooms are small it worked fine for us,since it was just the two of us. I would stay here again and would recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: El Caribe Resort and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2125 South Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118
